summary:
KMD Brands Trading Update – Key Takeaways

Sales Performance (10 months to May 2025, unaudited, NZ$)

  • Rip Curl:
  • Global DTC sales ↑ YOY in 2H FY25 (strong NA flagship growth).
  • Wholesale still ↓ YOY but improving vs. 1H FY25.
  • Kathmandu:
  • DTC sales for first 17 days of June ↑ 13.2% YOY (YTD now +0.3%).
  • Volatility due to warm weather (hit Insulation category), but Rainwear, Fleece, Knits, Footwear ↑ YOY.
  • Oboz:
  • Wholesale sales ↓ YOY but improving vs. 1H FY25.
  • Online sales ↑ YTD despite US tariff uncertainty.
  • Group online sales: +10.7% YTD (Kathmandu's new platform drove +26.1% growth since May).

Financial & Operational Highlights

  • FY25 EBITDA guidance: $15–25M (remaining trade dependent).
  • US tariff impact: Estimated ~$1M EBITDA hit in FY25.
  • Net debt (31 Jul 2025): Expected ~$70M.
  • Banking covenants: Amended for next two periods; compliance expected.

Inventory & Strategy

  • Targeting lower FY24 inventory levels.
  • Investor Day in September to detail growth initiatives.

No material capital markets activity (e.g., raising, halt) identified.

• Buy-back Type: On-market buy-back
  • Total Shares Outstanding: 101,964,147 (class subject to buy-back)
  • Buy-back Cap: Up to 5% of ordinary shares (no minimum guaranteed)
  • Buy-back Period: 13/5/2025 to 29/4/2026
  • Daily Buy-back Activity (17/6/2025):
  • 37,570 shares bought back (AUD 19,524.59 total consideration)
  • Price range: AUD 0.510 (low) to AUD 0.525 (high)
  • Prior Cumulative Buy-back: 155,439 shares (AUD 93,572.11 total consideration)
  • Broker: Ord Minnett Limited

No material information identified beyond buy-back execution details.

• Substantial holding change: Steven Newman & NMC Investment Trust reduced stakes in EROAD Ltd (NZX: ERD).
  • Steven Newman:
    • Current holding: 5.347% (10,020,952 shares)
    • Prior holding: 7.290% (13,474,111 shares)

  • NMC Investment Trust:

    • Current holding: 5.257% (9,853,024 shares)
    • Prior holding: 7.195% (13,297,083 shares)

  • Key transaction: NMC Trust sold 2 million shares on 13 June 2025 for A$2.82m (on-market).

  • Additional sales: 1.44m shares sold between 26 Feb 2024–30 May 2025 for A$1.35m.
  • Effective control: Steven Newman retains influence over holdings via family trusts and NMC ownership (>20%).

No other material information identified.

• Term sheet signed for strategic energy reserve centered on Huntly Power Station (Rankine Units) to address national energy security concerns.
  • Key drivers: Decline in natural gas supply, low hydro/wind conditions, and medium-term gas supply outlook.
  • Proposed timeline: Agreement aims to keep Rankine Units operational until 2035 (originally scheduled for retirement from 2026).
  • Commercial structure: Similar to prior "Huntly Firming Options"; 10-year term with potential biomass transition.
  • Target operational date: 1 January 2026 (certainty required by early November 2025 for compliance works).
  • Market impact: Residual capacity may be offered via hedging products post-agreement.

No capital raising, financial figures, or binding commitments disclosed.
